result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnulfo Hernandez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------------

Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees 
---------------------------------------
Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
---------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
-------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
-------------------------------------

Defendant Arnulfo Hernandez Jr in court.  Attorney Katharine Cullen in court for Arnulfo Hernandez Jr. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. records.addlTxt: Victim's request to lift no contact

Defendant Arnulfo Hernandez Jr in court. DA Wiedenfeld for the State. Bond includes no contact. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

DEFENDANT MUST POST $250 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): G.B. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
